fishergw.taylorf2 package¶

Submodules¶

fishergw.taylorf2.fisher module¶

class fishergw.taylorf2.fisher.Fisher(signal, integration_method=<function simps>, psd_name=None, detector=None, keys=None, log_scale_keys=[])[source]¶

Bases: object

An object to load the power spectral density (PSD) and compute the signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) and the Fisher matrix elements of a gravitational wave signal. The SNR and the Fisher matrix are averaged over orientation and inclination angles.

Attributes:

signal (TaylorF2) – A TaylorF2 waveform instance.

integration_method (scipy.integrate) – An integration method from the scipy.integrate module.

psd (scipy.interpolate.interp1d) – Interpolant of the PSD. An instance of scipy.interpolate.interp1d.

fmin (float) – If psd_name is provided, fmin is the corresponding minimum frequency. Otherwise, fmin = None.

fmax (float) – If psd_name is provided, fmax is the corresponding maximum frequency. Otherwise, fmax = None.

Qavg (float) – Angle-averaging factor \(Q\). When load_psd() is called, the PSD is divided by \(Q^2\) to ensure that the SNR and the Fisher matrix elements are angle-averaged.

keys (list) – Independent variables w.r.t. which the Fisher matrix is evaluated.

_detectors_ (dict) – Dictionary mapping built-in detectors to their psd_name and angle-averaging factor \(Q\). Built-in detectors are Advanced Ligo (‘aLigo’), Cosmic Explorer (‘CE’), Einstein Telescope (‘ET’) and LISA (‘lisa’). The following conventions hold for \(Q\):

‘aLigo’ and ‘CE’ are mapped to the factor \(Q=2/5\) for a two-armed 90-degrees detector (see, e.g., Eq. (7.177) in [1]);

‘ET’ is mapped to \(Q=2/5\sqrt{3/2}\), the additional factor \(\sqrt{3/2}\) coming from the fact that ET is a three-armed 60-degrees detector with two channels (see Eq. (4) in https://arxiv.org/abs/1012.0908);

‘lisa’ is mapped to \(Q=2/\sqrt{5}\). This only accounts for averaging over the inclination angle, because the LISA sensitivity curve is already averaged over orientation and detector channels (see Eq.s (2,8-9) in https://arxiv.org/abs/1803.01944).

References:

[1] Maggiore, Michele. Gravitational waves: Volume 1: Theory and experiments. Vol. 1. Oxford university press, 2008.

__init__(signal, integration_method=<function simps>, psd_name=None, detector=None, keys=None, log_scale_keys=[])[source]¶
Parameters

  • signal (TaylorF2) – A TaylorF2 waveform instance

  • integration_method (scipy.integrate object, default= scipy.integrate.simps) – The integration method to compute the SNR and the Gisher matrix elements.

  • psd_name (filepath or None, optional) – The path to a text file with the tabulated PSD. If None, psd defaults to 1.0. If detector is not None, psd_name is read from the _detectors_ dictionary

  • detector (str or None, optional) – If not None, must be one of ['aLigo','CE','ET','lisa'].

  • keys (list of str or None) – Independent variables w.r.t. which the Fisher matrix is evaluated. If None, defaults to self.signal.keys.

  • log_scale_keys (list) – Subset of keys to be converted in log scale when computing the Fisher. Defaults to the empty list.

correlation_matrix(fm, svd=True)[source]¶

Returns the correlation matrix. If svd, the Fisher matrix is inverted with a singular value decomposition.

Parameters

fm (numpy.array, shape (len(keys),len(keys))) – The Fisher matrix.

Return type

numpy.array, shape (len(keys),len(keys))

covariance_matrix(fm, svd=True)[source]¶

Returns the covariance matrix. If svd, the Fisher matrix is inverted with a singular value decomposition.

Parameters

fm (numpy.array, shape (len(keys),len(keys))) – The Fisher matrix.

Return type

numpy.array, shape (len(keys),len(keys))

fisher_matrix(fmin=None, fmax=None, nbins=100000, priors=None)[source]¶

Returns the Fisher matrix. Gaussian priors can be specified based on https://arxiv.org/abs/gr-qc/9502040.

Parameters

  • fmin – Minimum frequency. If None, defaults to the minimum frequency set by the provided PSD file.

  • fmax (float or None, optional) – Maximum frequency. If None, defaults to the maximum frequency set by the provided PSD file.

  • nbins (int, default=1e5) – Binning of the integration domain.

  • priors (dict or None) – Dictionary mapping a key with the standard deviation of its Gaussian prior. Defaults to None.

Return type

numpy.array, shape (len(keys),len(keys))

invert_matrix(fm, tol=1e-06)[source]¶

Returns the inverse of the Fisher matrix. A singular value decomposition is applied and directions with singular values smaller than tol are discarded.

Parameters

  • fm (numpy.array, shape (len(keys),len(keys))) – The Fisher matrix.

  • tol (float) – Directions with singular values smaller than tol are discarded when inverting the matrix. Default: 1e-6.

Return type

numpy.array, shape (len(keys),len(keys))

load_psd(psd_name, Qavg=1.0)[source]¶

Loads the PSD from a text file. Initializes the attributes psd, fmin, fmax and Qavg.

Parameters

  • psd_name (filepath) – Path to the PSD text file.

  • Qavg (float, default=1.0) – Value of the angle-averaging factor. See the description in the Fisher attributes.

Returns

self instance

Return type

Fisher

sigma1d(fm, svd=True)[source]¶

Returns the standard deviations of the 1D marginalized posteriors. If svd, the Fisher matrix is inverted with a singular value decomposition.

Parameters

fm (numpy.array, shape (len(keys),len(keys))) – The Fisher matrix.

Returns

Dictionary mapping keys to the corresponding standard deviations.

Return type

dict

snr(fmin=None, fmax=None, nbins=100000)[source]¶

Returns the SNR of the signal.

Parameters

  • fmin (float or None, optional) – Minimum frequency. If None, defaults to the minimum frequency set by the provided PSD file.

  • fmax (float or None, optional) – Maximum frequency. If None, defaults to the maximum frequency set by the provided PSD file.

  • nbins (int, default=1e5) – Binning of the integration domain.

Return type

float

fishergw.taylorf2.waveform module¶

class fishergw.taylorf2.waveform.CompactObject(mass, spin, Lamda=0.0, kappa=1.0)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class to define an isolated compact object.

Attributes:

mass (float) – Mass [\(M_\odot\)].

spin (float) – Dimensionless spin.

Lamda (float) – Dimensionless tidal deformability.

kappa (float) – Dimensionless spin-induced quadrupole moment.

__init__(mass, spin, Lamda=0.0, kappa=1.0)[source]¶
Parameters

  • mass (float) – Mass [\(M_\odot\)].

  • spin (float) – Dimensionless spin.

  • Lamda (float, default=0.0) – Tidal deformability. Defaults to the black hole value.

  • kappa (float, default=1.0) – Dimensionless spin-induced quadrupole moment. Defaults to the black hole value.

class fishergw.taylorf2.waveform.TaylorF2(obj1, obj2, d_L=100.0, t_c=0.0, phi_c=0.0, redshift=False, PN_phase=3.5)[source]¶

Bases: object

TaylorF2 frequency-domain template for the inspiral waveform from a binary coalescence.

Attributes:

d_L (float) – Luminosity distance [Mpc].

t_c (float) – Time of coalescence.

phi_c (float) – Phase of coalescence.

M (float) – Total mass in the detector frame [m].

Note

In TaylorF2, masses are transformed in units of meters as \(MG/c^2\).

kappa_s (float) – Symmetrized quadrupole moment.

kappa_a (float) – Antisymmetrized quadrupole moment.

eta (float) – Symmetric mass ratio.

M_c (float) – Chirp mass in the detector frame [m].

q (float) – Mass ratio obj1.mass/obj2.mass.

chi_s (float) – Symmetrized dimensionless spin.

chi_a (float) – Antisymmetrized dimensionless spin.

Lamda_T (float) – Dimensionless tidal deformability of the binary, according to Eq. (14) in https://arxiv.org/abs/1410.8866.

delta_Lambda (float) – Auxiliary tidal parameter, according to Eq. (15) in https://arxiv.org/abs/1410.8866.

keys (list)– Independent variables w.r.t. which the Fisher matrix is evaluated. Defaults ['t_c','phi_c','M_c','eta','chi_s','chi_a']. If Lambda_T is not zero, ['Lamda_T','delta_Lamda'] are added to keys.

Note

Because the TaylorF2 phase is linear in t_c and phi_c, the actual values of t_c and phi_c are irrelevant to the computation of the Fisher matrix and can be left to their default.

Note

TaylorF2 assumes that the normalization of Eq. (7.177) in [1], without the angular factor Q.

References:

[1] Maggiore, Michele. Gravitational waves: Volume 1: Theory and experiments. Vol. 1. Oxford university press, 2008.

__call__(f)[source]¶

Returns the value of the strain at a given frequency.

Parameters

f (float) – Frequency [Hz].

Return type

complex

__init__(obj1, obj2, d_L=100.0, t_c=0.0, phi_c=0.0, redshift=False, PN_phase=3.5)[source]¶
Parameters

  • obj1 (CompactObject) – Primary compact object in the binary.

  • obj2 (CompactObject) – Secondary compact object in the binary.

  • d_L (float, default=100.0) – Luminosity distance [Mpc].

  • t_c (float, default=0.0) – Time of coalescence.

  • phi_c (float, default=0.0) – Phase of coalescence.

  • redshift ((half-)integer, default=3.5) – If True, the masses are redshifted, otherwise the redshift is neglected.

Parama PN_phase

The PN order up to wich the waveform phase is expanded. It does not include tidal terms at 5PN and 6PN orders. They are activated whenever obj1 or obj2 have a nonvanishing tidal Love number.

isco(mode='static')[source]¶

Returns the ISCO frequency of the system.

Parameters

mode (str, default='static') – If static, neglects the contribution of the indivudal spins. Currently, this is the only supported option.

Return type

float

start_frequency_from_obs_time(obs_time=1.0)[source]¶

Returns the starting frequency given the osbervational time, as per Eq. (2.15) in https://arxiv.org/abs/gr-qc/0411129v2.

Parameters

obs_time (float, default=1.0) – The observational time [yr].

Return type

float

class fishergw.taylorf2.waveform_andrea.TaylorF2(obj1, obj2, d_L=100.0, t_c=0.0, phi_c=0.0, redshift=False, PN_phase=3.5)[source]¶

Bases: object

TaylorF2 frequency-domain template for the inspiral waveform from a binary coalescence.

Attributes:

d_L (float) – Luminosity distance [Mpc].

t_c (float) – Time of coalescence.

phi_c (float) – Phase of coalescence.

M (float) – Total mass in the detector frame [m].

Note

In TaylorF2, masses are transformed in units of meters as \(MG/c^2\).

kappa_s (float) – Symmetrized quadrupole moment.

kappa_a (float) – Antisymmetrized quadrupole moment.

eta (float) – Symmetric mass ratio.

M_c (float) – Chirp mass in the detector frame [m].

q (float) – Mass ratio obj1.mass/obj2.mass.

chi_s (float) – Symmetrized dimensionless spin.

chi_a (float) – Antisymmetrized dimensionless spin.

Lamda_T (float) – Dimensionless tidal deformability of the binary, according to Eq. (14) in https://arxiv.org/abs/1410.8866.

delta_Lambda (float) – Auxiliary tidal parameter, according to Eq. (15) in https://arxiv.org/abs/1410.8866.

keys (list)– Independent variables w.r.t. which the Fisher matrix is evaluated. Defaults ['t_c','phi_c','M_c','eta','chi_s','chi_a'] If Lambda_T is not zero, ['Lamda_T','delta_Lamda'] are added to keys.

Note

Because the TaylorF2 phase is linear in t_c and phi_c, the actual values of t_c and phi_c are irrelevant to the computation of the Fisher matrix and can be left to their default.

Note

TaylorF2 assumes that the normalization of Eq. (7.177) in [1], without the angular factor Q.

References:

[1] Maggiore, Michele. Gravitational waves: Volume 1: Theory and experiments. Vol. 1. Oxford university press, 2008.
